content.body: could someone fill out the missing date/time info on the reflector post
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: could someone fill out the missing date/time info on the reflector post

content.body: well i guess the only thing really missing is the timezone, everything else can be inferred
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: well i guess the only thing really missing is the timezone, everything else can be inferred

content.body:
Next week's plenary is on the Tokyo JST timezone.  That means the start time of 10am on Tuesday in Tokyo corresponds to:

- Monday 6pm in Seattle (PT)
- Monday 9pm in New York (ET)
- Tuesday 2am in London (BST)
- Tuesday 3am in Berlin (CET)
- Tuesday 6:30am in Bengalaru (IST)
- Tuesday 9am in Shanghai (CST)
content.formatted_body:
Next week's plenary is on the Tokyo JST timezone. That means the start time of 10am on Tuesday in Tokyo corresponds to:

  • Monday 6pm in Seattle (PT)
  • Monday 9pm in New York (ET)
  • Tuesday 2am in London (BST)
  • Tuesday 3am in Berlin (CET)
  • Tuesday 6:30am in Bengalaru (IST)
  • Tuesday 9am in Shanghai (CST)

Next week's plenary is on the Tokyo JST timezone.  That means the start time of 10am on Tuesday in Tokyo corresponds to:

- Monday 6pm in Seattle (PT)
- Monday 9pm in New York (ET)
- Tuesday 2am in London (BST)
- Tuesday 3am in Berlin (CET)
- Tuesday 6:30am in Bengalaru (IST)
- Tuesday 9am in Shanghai (CST)
